intro: [WRONG START] Lathyrus clymenenum subsp. tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaf sweet pea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in loose clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is known for its climbing habit and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
